title: Doggo v0
subtitle: Robotic
description: Low-cost legged Robot dog with 12 joints powered by SG90 servo motors that is controlled by Raspberry Pi/Arduino. Aim to develop simple walking and standing capability with it. Designed with custom kinematics.

title: Hand Cursor
subtitle: Computer Vision
description: Control your cursor and click with your hands only, without a mouse. Just wave your hands and do a pinch gesture to your webcam will do.

title: Frontline Fighters
subtitle: Tech
description: Retro GBA Game developed in C and assembly language. The program uses button interrupts and game timer running at 10ms for optimal performance. Go on an adventurous journey as a frontline fighter, solving challenging puzzles and battling against viruses across each level, as the difficulty increases.

title: Train Solo8 to Walk
subtitle: Robotic
description: Use of Deep Reinforcement Learning to teach open source legged robot design Solo 8 to walk on both flat and rough terrain. Mujoco gym is used to emulate the physics to train the agent to walk, it is rewarded for distance and speed, while punished for idling, falling and veering off course.

title: Bumblebee AUV 4.0
subtitle: NUS Team Bumblebee
description: Principle hull and structure designer of the 4th Generation Bumblebee Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV). Encompassing design, structure rigidity and strength. Validated through Finite Element Analysis and Computation Fluid Dynamic Simulations.

title: Hornet AUV 4.0
subtitle: NUS Team Bumblebee - Trainee
description: Hornet 4.0 is the 4th iteration of the NUS Bumblebee freshmen programme. Came up with the frame design and integration of the vehicle within 8 months for the Singapore Autonomous Underwater Vehicle Competition (SAUVC 2018) with limited budgets.

title: ROS Gazebo
subtitle: Robotic
description: University Project using Robotic Operating System (ROS) Gazebo Virtual Simulator to implement a critically damped PID controller for Husky Robot. Followed by use of TurtleBot to navigate and solve maze in the most efficient method using Breath-First-Search.

title: ROS Co-Op Gazebo
subtitle: Subtitle 8
description: ROS Gazebo Co-Operation between UAV and TurtleBot to reach the target goal. It is completed as a university project using Robotic Operating System (ROS). Work includes PID control tuning, sensor data transformation, Kalman filter, finite-state-machine and etc.
